atableExtra 0.1.0
  • Reference

Format factors as `X (X%)` instead of `X% (X)`

format_statistics.statistics_factor.Rd

Almost an exact copy of the equivilent function from `atable`, this function just formats factors as e.g. 15 (25 25

# S3 method for statistics_factor
format_statistics(x, factorformat = "{N} ({percent}%)", ...)

Arguments

x

a `statistics_factor` object as created by `atable:::statistics.factor`
factorformat

how to format the values
...

passed to/from other methods

Details

When `atableExtra` loads, this function automatically overrides the `atable` version

Option `factorformat` uses the `glue` package to create strings. Although `glue` parses the values within the braces (`` and ``), this is not permitted in this case as only strings are passed to `glue`. Values that can be used in the are braces are `N`, `total` and `percent`.

Examples

data(mtcars)
mtcars$cyl <- as.factor(mtcars$cyl)
atable(mtcars, target_cols = "cyl")

#>            Group      value
#> 1  Observations            
#> 2  \\quad \\quad         32
#> 3     cyl \\quad           
#> 4       \\quad 4 11 (34\\%)
#> 5       \\quad 6  7 (22\\%)
#> 6       \\quad 8 14 (44\\%)
#> 7 \\quad missing   0 (0\\%)
